description.narrative: Oxfam in Mozambique has a large experience working on sexual and reproductive health rights, managing programs and partners. The Stand Up program will be implemented in the districts of Murrupula, Mecuburi and Nampula City, in Nampula province. The program aim toincrease enjoyment of sexual and reproductive health and rights by the most marginalized and vulnerable right-holders, particularlyadolescent girls (15-19 years) and young women (20-24 years) in the target districts. The program focuses on various local groups including adolescent girls and young women; men, boys, community influencers; the education sector; the health sector and service providers; CSOs, WROs and YLOs by addressing key gender inequality and human rights issues. In the program the country office will carry out the evaluation, contracts and monitor the activities of the partners and will guarantee the verification of the results quality; Will seek to do the documentation and analysis of the results, carried out by the team (program and financial officers); and Will hold annual, biannual and quarterly meetings with partners to present the progress achieved, the challenges faced, the lessons learned and the strategies defined for the sustainability of the program's actions and results.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to basic social services
